In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the number **nine** (or **9**) is not used to represent anything by default, but still serves the following purposes:

- [9]() and the other number keys can be used to specify a [numeric prefix](/wiki/Numeric_prefix "Numeric prefix") for a command or in a menu.

* If numpad movement is on, press [9]() to move north-east.

- Some players also change the "monsters" option in the [options](/wiki/Options "Options") file to utilize [unused symbols](/wiki/Unused_symbols "Unused symbols") like 9 for certain purposes.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

## Historical uses

From [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), the [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(monster\) "Giant (monster)") uses the 9 glyph.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [neutral angels and minions](/index.php?title=Neutral_angels_and_minions_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Neutral angels and minions (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") use the 9 glyph:

- 9 [Movanic Deva](/index.php?title=Movanic_Deva_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Movanic Deva (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Monadic Deva](/index.php?title=Monadic_Deva_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Monadic Deva (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Astral Deva](/index.php?title=Astral_Deva_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Astral Deva (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Graha Deva](/wiki/Graha_Deva "Graha Deva")
- 9 [Surya Deva](/wiki/Surya_Deva "Surya Deva")
- 9 [Mahadeva](/wiki/Mahadeva "Mahadeva")
- 9 [Iksh'na Deva](/index.php?title=Iksh%27na_Deva\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Iksh'na Deva (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Birth](/index.php?title=Birth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Birth (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Health](/wiki/Health "Health")
- 9 [Bounty](/index.php?title=Bounty\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bounty (page does not exist)")
- 9 [Peace](/index.php?title=Peace\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Peace (page does not exist)")

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the [gnoll](/wiki/Gnoll_\(monster_class\) "Gnoll (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") uses the 9 glyph.

SpliceHack adapts the gnoll monsters added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and introduces another monster to the class:

- 9 gnoll

  - 9 [gnoll](/wiki/Gnoll "Gnoll")
  - 9 [gnoll warrior](/wiki/Gnoll_warrior "Gnoll warrior")
  - 9 [gnoll chieftain](/wiki/Gnoll_chieftain "Gnoll chieftain")
  - 9 [gnoll shaman](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman")
  - 9 [marrashi](/wiki/Marrashi "Marrashi")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

9

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the number nine (or 9) is not used to represent anything by default, but still serves the following purposes:

  • 9 and the other number keys can be used to specify a numeric prefix for a command or in a menu.
  • If numpad movement is on, press 9 to move north-east.
  • Some players also change the "monsters" option in the options file to utilize unused symbols like 9 for certain purposes.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 dNetHack
    • 2.2 SpliceHack

Historical uses

From NetHack 1.3d to NetHack 2.3e, the giant uses the 9 glyph.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, neutral angels and minions use the 9 glyph:

  • 9 Movanic Deva
  • 9 Monadic Deva
  • 9 Astral Deva
  • 9 Graha Deva
  • 9 Surya Deva
  • 9 Mahadeva
  • 9 Iksh'na Deva
  • 9 Birth
  • 9 Health
  • 9 Bounty
  • 9 Peace

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, the gnoll monster class uses the 9 glyph.

SpliceHack adapts the gnoll monsters added in SLASH'EM and introduces another monster to the class:

  • 9 gnoll
    • 9 gnoll
    • 9 gnoll warrior
    • 9 gnoll chieftain
    • 9 gnoll shaman
    • 9 marrashi

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the number '''nine''' (or '''9''') is not used to represent anything by default, but still serves the following purposes:

* {{kbd|9}} and the other number keys can be used to specify a [[numeric prefix]] for a command or in a menu.

* If numpad movement is on, press {{kbd|9}} to move north-east.

* Some players also change the "monsters" option in the [[options]] file to utilize [[unused symbols]] like {{white|9}} for certain purposes.

==Historical uses==
From [[NetHack 1.3d]] to [[NetHack 2.3e]], the [[Giant (monster)|giant]] uses the {{white|9}} glyph.

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[Neutral angels and minions (dNetHack)|neutral angels and minions]] use the {{white|9}} glyph:

* {{white|9}} [[Movanic Deva (dNetHack)|Movanic Deva]]
* {{black|9}}  [[Monadic Deva (dNetHack)|Monadic Deva]]
* {{gray|9}}  [[Astral Deva (dNetHack)|Astral Deva]]
* {{brown|9}} [[Graha Deva]]
* {{yellow|9}} [[Surya Deva]]
* {{brightmagenta|9}} [[Mahadeva]]
* {{brightblue|9}} [[Iksh'na Deva]]
* {{magenta|9}} [[Birth]]
* {{magenta|9}} [[Health]]
* {{magenta|9}} [[Bounty]]
* {{magenta|9}} [[Peace]]

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], the [[Gnoll (monster class)|gnoll]] [[monster class]] uses the {{white|9}} glyph.

SpliceHack adapts the gnoll monsters added in [[SLASH'EM]] and introduces another monster to the class:

* {{white|9}} gnoll
** {{gray|9}} [[gnoll]]
** {{white|9}} [[gnoll warrior]]
** {{magenta|9}} [[gnoll chieftain]]
** {{yellow|9}} [[gnoll shaman]]
** {{yellow|9}} [[marrashi]]
{{nethack-367}}
[[Category:ASCII]]
